pr_title: [LW] Compress snapshots returned to the user

timeline.bodyText: Feels wrong that you would allow this?
timeline.author: jkozlowski

replies.bodyText: Wouldn't you want to validate this where the parent method is called? As I understand it, it's because it simplifies the code in LockWatchEventLog#getEventsBetweenVersions, where you just snapshotVersion + 1, but I think this complexity should live there. Because in all other cases calling this method with the versions inverted is probably wrong?
replies.author: jkozlowski

timeline.bodyText: Can you also add tests here? I think there's a bunch of edge cases to cover around the snapshot computation piece? Or add unit tests, whatever works for you.
timeline.author: jkozlowski

replies.bodyText:
we now have tests for:

no condensing
some condensing
max condensing

I think that covers all the main cases.
replies.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.author: jkozlowski

replies.bodyText: Factored out a check so that this is always the case (in ClientLockWatchSnapshot normally as well as in this case).
replies.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.bodyText: For completeness, can you also remove the "Preconditions.checkArgument(!startTimestamps.isEmpty(), "Cannot get events for empty set of transactions");" here; it's checked in the TimestampMapping
timeline.author: jkozlowski
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -100,7 +105,13 @@ public TransactionsLockWatchUpdate getUpdateForTransactions(
         lastKnownVersion.ifPresent(version -> assertTrue(version.version() <= timestampMapping.lastVersion().version(),

timeline.bodyText: This comment should just live on VersionBounds, if you really care about it.
timeline.author: jkozlowski

timeline.bodyText: Would we get anything in terms of simplification of code if this was taking Long startTimestamp, instead of Set? atlas-proxy just needs one transaction pushed here.
timeline.author: jkozlowski

replies.bodyText: Yes, that would be simpler, but I don't think by leaps and bounds - it just simplifies what we can compress a little.
replies.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.bodyText: We want to get the events after the snapshot only
timeline.author: Jolyon-S
gmaretic
gmaretic

timeline.bodyText: that versionRange() method is super overengineered, since the correctness relies on the check below it at which point you can literally just do range of first event.sequence + length of list -1 instead of fancy streams
timeline.author: gmaretic
gmaretic

replies.bodyText: Not only because I only make a range if the events are non-empty, but also because of the other check. Removed.
replies.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.author: gmaretic

replies.bodyText: Don't worry, I've come to see the sins of my ways.
replies.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.bodyText:
Maybe the invariant holds, but this is also just easier to read

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                                firstVersion <= latestVersion.get().version()
          
          
            
                                versionRange().get().contains(latestVersion.get().version())
timeline.author: gmaretic

replies.bodyText: That's not the same check - what if latest version is > the upper bound of the range?
replies.author: Jolyon-S

replies.bodyText: Although, on review of the code, I don't think that can happen.
replies.author: Jolyon-S

replies.bodyText: but to be safe, I'd prefer to do this.
replies.author: Jolyon-S

replies.bodyText: I know it's not equivalent, but the method name assertNoEventsAreMissing implies they are connected. So then change the method name to assertNoEventsAreMissingAfterLatestVersion?
replies.author: gmaretic

timeline.author: gmaretic
